post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, November 6
post.Content:
A little bit of an interesting week this week!

  • I announced that I was leaving Oracle. As I mentioned in that announcement, for now I plan to keep things going as always - weekly links, open source projects for JavaFX, etc.
  • Edvin Syse is interviewed about TornadoFX, a Kotlin library for JavaFX, of which there was a new release just recently.
  • Gerrit Grunwald has put out another of his Friday Fun components - this time a 'sun burst' control.
  • Speaking of Gerrit, he has also put on github a 'smoothcharts' library that makes the JavaFX chart lines be smoothed lines.
  • Amos Chepchieng has written about making a borderless JavaFX window movable.
  • Jyloo Software has put out Synthetica V3 RC1 for review.
